PAGE.TITLE: Integration by parts
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
Integration by parts involves using the product rule in reverse. In essence you recognise the following equality
when you apply the fundamental theorem of calculus to the product rule:
$$
\int u {dv \over dx} dx = uv - \int v {du \over dx} . dx \quad .
$$

UL.LI: You should be able to solve definite and indefinite integrals using integration by parts.
You should be able to solve more complex integrals by using integration by parts multiple times.
You should be able to solve more complex definite and indefinite integrals using a combination of integration by substitution and integration by parts.
